info.name: 10 PRINT inspired maze
info.description:
Simple, optionally time varying shader inspired by the famous C64 one-line maze generator 10 PRINT CHR$ (INT(205.5 + RND(1)) ; : GOTO 10
More information (a whole book!) on this deceptively simple code can be found at https://10print.org

renderpass.code:
#define CellNumber 15. // how many cells span the shorter side, any float
#define Bias 0. // how frequent fwd slashes are relative to back slashes, [-0.5 ~ 0.5] default 0.
#define Thickness 0.2 // how thick the slashes are, [0. ~ 1.] default 0.2
#define TimeFactor 0.05 // how quickly the picture evolves, any float, default 0. or 0.05

float random( vec2 n ){ // https://thebookofshaders.com/10/
    return fract(sin(dot(n.xy, vec2(12.9898, 78.233))) * 
        (43758.5453 + TimeFactor*iTime)); // default prng has no iTime
}

float slash (in vec2 position, vec2 uv){ //generates slash given cell coordinate and cell uv
    float direction = random(position), result; // random float [0. ~ 1.]
    if (direction > 0.5 - Bias) //choose cell orientation
        abs(uv.x - uv.y) < Thickness ? result = 1. : result; // downleft - upright : fwd slash
    else
        abs(uv.x + uv.y - 1.) < Thickness ? result = 1. : result; // upleft - downright : backslash
    return result;
}

void mainImage(out vec4 fragColor, in vec2 fragCoord){
    vec2 uv = fragCoord.xy / min(iResolution.x, iResolution.y); // uv coordinates
    vec2 pos = floor(uv * CellNumber) / CellNumber; // cell coordinates
    vec2 celluv = fract(uv*CellNumber); // uv for each cell
    float result = slash(pos, celluv); // draw slashes
fragColor = vec4( result , 0.0 , 0.0 , 1.0);
}
